Main

Class Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • Main.Driver

  • public class Driver
extends java.lang.Object
    Runs the Book Managment System. This: 1. Validates all the book entires 2. Creates the validated output files 3. Displays a navigation menu to the user that allows them to view any book record in the system.

      Displays the Main Menu to the user through the console.
      private static void do_part1()
      Validates syntax and partition book records based on genre into text files.
      private static void do_part2()
      Validates semantics, read the genre files each into arrays of Book objects, then serialize the arrays of Book objects each into binary files.
      private static void do_part3()
      Reads the binary files, deserialize the array objects in each file and stores them in their corresponding OutputFile, then provides an interacive program to allow the user to navigate the Book arrays of the OutputFiles.

      Finds the OutputFile from the passed list that has the targetGenre.

                                   java.lang.String currentLine,

      • do_part1

        private static void do_part1()

      • validateIsbn10

        private static void validateIsbn10(java.lang.String fileName,
                                   java.lang.String currentLine)
                            throws SemanticException
        Validates the ISBN of the current book record only if it has exactly 10 digits. A valid ISBN only contains numbers and where sum(10x1 + 9x2 + 8x3 + 7x4 + 6x5 + 5x6 + 4x7 + 3x8 + 2x9 + 1x10) is a multiple of 11.
        Parameters:
        fileName -
        currentLine -
        Throws:
        SemanticException

      • validateIsbn13

        private static void validateIsbn13(java.lang.String fileName,
                                   java.lang.String currentLine)
                            throws SemanticException
        Validates the current record's ISBN only if it has exactly 13 digits. A valid ISBN only contains numbers and where sum(x1 +3x2 +x3 +3x4 +x5 +3x6 +x7 +3x8 +x9 +3x10 +x11 +3x12 +x13) is a multiple of 10.
        Parameters:
        fileName -
        currentLine -
        Throws:
        SemanticException

      • selectFile

        private static int selectFile(OutputFile[] outputFiles,
                              int currentFileIndex)
        Dilsplays the File Sub-Menu and all of the OutputFiles a user can choose to navigate. Prompts the user for a number corresponding to the file they want to navigate. Validates that the user's input corresponds to one of the available options. If the user enters a number corresponding to 1 + the total number of available files, the Sub-Menu will exit and return to the Main Menu.
        Parameters:
        outputFiles -
        currentFileIndex -
        Returns:
        updated currentFileIndex (corresponding to user input)

      • validateNumber

        private static int validateNumber()
        Prompts the user to enter the number of Book objects they want displayed. Validates that the user's input is a integer.
        Returns:
        integer corresponding to how many records the user want to display.

      • viewFile

        private static void viewFile(OutputFile[] OutputFile,
                             int currentFileIndex,
                             int currentBookIndex)
        Calls validateNumber() to get the number of Book objects the user wants displayed in the OutputFile at the currentFileIndex then displayes them. The number of Books to be displayed corresponds to the number (n) inputed by the user. The first book displayed will always be Book at the currentBookIndex, followed by the n-1 Books below or above it in the array, depending on if n is positive or negative. If the end or begining of the array is reached, and appropriate error message will be displayed to the console and the currentBookIndex will correspond to either the last or first book in the array, respectively. The user will get re-prompted as long as they don't enter 0, which will return the user back to the Main Menu.
        Parameters:
        OutputFile -
        currentFileIndex -
        currentBookIndex -

      • runMenu

        public static void runMenu(OutputFile[] outputFiles)
        Takes in an array of OutputFiles and runs the visual navigation Menu for the user. Will end the program if the user enters the value x (not case sensitive).
        Parameters:
        outputFiles -

      • do_part3

        private static void do_part3()
        Reads the binary files, deserialize the array objects in each file and stores them in their corresponding OutputFile, then provides an interacive program to allow the user to navigate the Book arrays of the OutputFiles.

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
